title: 'Alarming': Reporter reacts after being singled out by sheriff
description: LA Times reporter Alene Tchekmedyian reacts to being singled out by Los Angeles County Sheriff Alex Villanueva after the Times obtained leaked video allegedly showing use of force inside a jail by a deputy. CNN's Nick Watt has more.

title: Americans are tipping less in the wake of tipping fatigue
description: Service tips spiked at the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic. Two years later, the service economy is witnessing a drop in tips. CNN's Tom Foreman explores a Washington DC pizzeria affected by tipping fatigue and a general confusion surrounding the shifting tip culture.

title: Ukrainian journalist killed in Russian strike on central Kyiv
description: An overnight Russian strike on central Kyiv killed a 54-year-old Ukrainian journalist and left residents shaken. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: Stalin's influence on Vladimir Putin
description: Many comparisons have been drawn between Vladimir Putin's brutality and ambitions in Ukraine, and those of soviet leader Joseph Stalin. Bianca Nobilo discusses the legacy of these two leaders with historian and author Simon Sebag Montefiore.

title: Trevor Reed's family speaks after his release from Russian prison
description: American Trevor Reed, a US citizen and former Marine who had been detained in Russia since 2019, is back in the US. CNN's Jake Tapper talks to his parents and sister.

title: Watch James Corden's most memorable moments from 'The Late Late Show'
description: James Corden will leave "The Late Late Show" in 2023. Here are some of the most memorable moments from his show, from the fan-favorite "Carpool Karaoke" series to the controversial "Spill Your Guts" segments.

title: NATO scrambles fighter jets to intercept Russian planes
description: NATO fighter jets stationed in both the Baltic and Black Sea regions scrambled "multiple times over the past four days" to track and intercept Russian aircraft near alliance airspace, according to a statement posted by NATO's Allied Air Command. CNN's Barbara Starr reports.

title: Putin keeps the ruble surging as Russia makes 11th-hour effort to avoid default
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's efforts to support the ruble continue to pay off — and then some.

title: 'That's the prize': Russians make push for western side of Dnieper River
description: CNN's Nick Paton Walsh speaks to citizens caught in the fast-changing landscape near the Dnieper River, a site Russian soldiers are pushing to control.

title: At least five Russian businessmen have died by apparent suicide in just three months
description: At least five prominent Russian businessmen have reportedly died by suicide since late January, with three of them allegedly killing members of their families before taking their own lives.

title: CDC releases new details in unusual hepatitis cases in children
description: The US Centers of Disease Control and Prevention continues to investigate cases of acute hepatitis with unknown causes among children and released new clinical details about some of the cases on Friday.

title: US military returns birthday cake to Italian woman, 77 years after American soldiers stole it
description: The US military returned a birthday cake to an Italian woman, exactly 77 years after American soldiers fighting in her local village ate the original gateau that was made for her 13th birthday.

title: The 'Pachinko' finale highlights the real-life women whose stories aren't found in history books
description: At the center of "Pachinko," the Apple TV+ adaptation of Min Jin Lee's epic novel, is a character named Sunja -- a woman born in Japanese-occupied Korea who leaves her homeland for the imperial country in the early 20th century.

title: Boris Becker sentenced to two-and-a-years in jail over bankruptcy charges
description: Six-time grand slam champion Boris Becker was sentenced to two-and-a-half years in jail on Friday for flouting the terms of his bankruptcy in 2017, the UK's PA media reported.

title: At least 5 killed, many more feared dead after explosion at Kabul mosque
description: At least five people were killed and 20 wounded after an explosion at a mosque in the Afghan capital Kabul after Friday prayers, Taliban spokesperson for the chief of police Khalid Zadran said -- but eyewitnesses said they feared many more had died.

title: Kyiv accuses Moscow of threatening global food security as Russians target important railway hub and supply line in eastern Ukraine
The art dealer revolutionizing Paris' gallery scene
description: When Mariane Ibrahim opened her elegant, new three-story art gallery in Paris last September, she became the first Black gallerist to set up shop in the French capital, and, according to the Somali-French art dealer, the first dedicated to showing contemporary art from Africa and its diaspora.

title: Potential showdown between Biden and Putin at G20
description: President Joe Biden and his advisers are still in conversations about how to approach November's Group of 20 summit, whose hosts received confirmation Friday that Russian President Vladimir Putin plans to attend.

title: Back to the doctor's office? Here's what's next for telehealth after the pandemic
description: It all started with a toothache.

title: A 61-year-old is set to row solo from the US to France. The entire journey will be nearly 4,000 miles
description: Over the next couple of months, one man will attempt to row close to 4,000 miles across the Atlantic Ocean.

title: A brief history of 'covfefe'
description: On Thursday, Donald Trump returned to his much-touted -- and to date, deeply underwhelming -- social media venture: Truth Social.

title: 'Serious' Joe Biden looks to prove he can be actually funny
description: It was 2014 and Diamond Joe was having a moment.

title: West Ham investigating incident after fans allegedly attack German commentators live on air
description: West Ham United are investigating an incident in which two German commentators were allegedly attacked inside the London Stadium during the team's Europa League semifinal first leg against Eintracht Frankfurt on Thursday.

title: The Fed's favorite inflation measure hit a fresh 40-year high
description: Americans had to reach deeper into their pockets in March, as yet another key inflation index showed prices hit a fresh 40-year high.

title: A frustrated Joe Biden will go on the attack against Republicans in the midterms -- and into 2024
description: President Joe Biden has been letting loose in private conversations in recent weeks, railing about the factors bogging down his approval ratings and the people he thinks aren't helping -- including Democrats eyeing his job despite his clear promise to run for reelection.

title: Apple loses top spot in China as smartphone sales slump
description: Just three months ago, Apple became the top-selling smartphone brand in China for the first time in six years. Now it's fallen back behind its Chinese rivals after suffering more than others from a first quarter slump in sales.

title: A new realization dawns in the US and Europe
Why Saudi Arabia and Turkey are making up now
description: There is so much Saudi Arabia and Turkey could do together, and now could be their moment.

title: Extremely critical fire conditions return to the Southwest and tornadoes threaten the Central Plains
description: A strong storm system moving Friday through the Rockies and Plains will whip up winds, raising worries of more fires in the Southwest and tornadoes on the Great Plains.

title: Could there be life in space? Scientists hope this new tool will provide clues
description: "The Hunt for Planet B" follows scientists as they build and plan for the launch of NASA's Webb Telescope, the most powerful and complex space telescope.

title: 30 exocomets found orbiting star in nearby planetary system
description: The nearby Beta Pictoris planetary system, located 63 light-years away from us, has fascinated researchers for decades.

title: Michael Douglas confirms longtime Hollywood rumors
description: Michael Douglas has spoken out for the first time about refusing to work with actress Debra Winger after she allegedly bit him on the arm.

title: A robot lives in this Antarctic penguin colony. It's trying to save them
description: Thousands of emperor penguins cluster on the ice of Atka Bay in Antarctica, mostly unaware that an interloper lives among them.

title: Sharon Osbourne tearfully reveals husband Ozzy has Covid-19
description: Sharon Osbourne is taking some time off from her new job to help her husband through Covid-19.

title: Warren Buffett fans have plenty to cheer this weekend
description: Berkshire Hathaway investors are set to descend on Omaha, Nebraska, for the company's first annual meeting with shareholders present since 2019. It should be a victory lap for CEO Warren Buffett.

title: 'Ozark' cements its place among Netflix's best dramas with its final episodes
description: For anyone inclined initially to dismiss "Ozark" as "Breaking Bad Lite," the Netflix drama has exceeded all expectations, steadily building toward a final run reinforcing the idea that getting into business with very bad people is going to have consequences. The fourth season has also become a family affair, adding a deeper hook to the Byrde saga that delivers tension right up until the last frame.

title: Expect Putin to make a big announcement on May 9
description: On May 9 -- known as Victory Day in Russia -- President Vladimir Putin will need to make a bombastic and very public display to suggest he is winning the war in Ukraine.

title: Much of Europe is now facing stagflation. France is already there.
description: The European economy slowed in the first three months of the year due to a combination of soaring inflation and early fallout from the war in Ukraine.

title: US astronaut describes needing to borrow Russian cosmonauts' toilet
description: The first all-private mission to the International Space Station brokered by Axiom Space successfully splashed down, but not before the US astronauts needed to borrow Russian cosmonauts' toilet while in space. AX-1 pilot Larry Connor speaks to CNN.

title: Analysis: Prince Andrew losing 'Freedom of City' honor sends a strong message
description: The sexual assault lawsuit against Prince Andrew has been settled, but he's still very much on trial in the court of public opinion -- and much of Britain has already reached its verdict.

title: Pasta with gold: Tucci raves of 'perfectly balanced' dish
description: Chef Chiara Pavan runs the Michelin-starred restaurant near Venice that uses ingredients from the salty soil, like asparagus and velvet artichokes. Don't miss "Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy" on CNN Sundays at 9 p.m. ET/PT.

title: China may be getting ready to wind down its crackdown on big tech
description: Shares of Chinese tech companies soared on Friday after Beijing signaled that it may throw the beleagured industry a lifeline and promised again to minimize the impact of Covid-19 on the economy.

title: Chaos as American family brings unexploded shell to Israel airport
description: An American family caused havoc at Israel's Ben Gurion airport in Tel Aviv on Thursday when they tried to transport an unexploded shell through airport security.

title: Chris Paul makes NBA playoff history in Phoenix Suns' closeout win over the New Orleans Pelicans
description: Chris Paul shot a perfect 14-of-14 from the field to help the Phoenix Suns close out their opening round playoff series with a 115-109 Game 6 win over the New Orleans Pelicans.

title: Katie Taylor vs. Amanda Serrano: Two female boxers headline at Madison Square Garden for the first time in its 140-year history
description: For the first time in its 140-year history, two female boxers are headlining at Madison Square Garden as undisputed lightweight champion Katie Taylor goes toe-to-toe with seven-weight champion Amanda Serrano in the ring on Saturday.

title: Asia's 50 best bars for 2022 revealed
description: With pandemic travel restrictions easing in much of the region, the annual Asia's 50 Best Bars ceremony took place in front of a live audience for the first time since 2019 on Thursday evening.

title: Eileen Gu sparks praise and debate after thanking China in farewell post
description: "Thank you China," complete with a Chinese flag and a heart emoji, might seem like an innocuous enough farewell message from China's Winter Olympics superstar Eileen Gu.

title: 'Leonardo da Vinci of violins' goes up for auction in France
description: A near three-century-old instrument lauded as a Leonardo da Vinci of violins could fetch as much as 10 million euros ($10.6 million) when it is auctioned next month, the French house overseeing the sale said.

title: CNN reporter shows what it's like to travel into China
description: CNN's Selina Wang shows what it's like to travel into China, one of the hardest places to enter in the world.

title: Navalny associate on Putin's threats
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper speaks to Vladimir Ashurkov, a close associate of Alexey Navalny, who reacts to Russian President Vladimir Putin's vague threat to countries intervening in Ukraine.

title: Camera captures 'jaw-dropping' view inside of a shark's mouth
description: See what it's like to end up in the mouth of a shark. CNN's Jeanne Moos takes us there.

title: The world's most challenging cruise ship routes
description: Navigating a colossal ship is no mean feat under any conditions, but certain routes, like the sandstorm-prone, narrow Suez Canal -- infamously blocked by a container ship last year -- or the windy, glacier-lined waterways of Alaska, are particularly challenging.

title: Anderson finally meets Ukrainian mom sheltered in Kyiv after speaking for months
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper finally meets Ukrainian mom Olena Gnes in person after interviewing her several times since the Russian invasion.
